description: A structured descriptive survey of the organizational principles of computer hardware, emphasizing
trade-offs among architectural choices and representative examples.  Topics include virtual
machines, overview of computer organization, forms of parallelism, machine-level representation
of data, memory organization, digital logic, functional organization, microprogrammed and RISC
architectures, performance enhancements and alternative architectures, assembly-level
machine organization and programming, and architecture of networks and their protocols.
Prerequisite: Computer Science 121 or consent of the instructor.
